fr.ign.artiscales.scenario

Class PMStep

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.ign.artiscales.scenario.PMStep

  • public class PMStep
extends java.lang.Object
    Object representing each step of a Parcel Manager scenario. This object is automatically set by the PMScenario object.
    Author:
    Maxime Colomb
    See Also:
    scenarioCreation.md

    • Method Detail

      • setFiles

        public static void setFiles(java.io.File parcelFile,
                            java.io.File isletFile,
                            java.io.File zoningFile,
                            java.io.File tmpFolder,
                            java.io.File buildingFile,
                            java.io.File roadFile,
                            java.io.File predicateFile,
                            java.io.File polygonIntersection,
                            java.io.File outFolder,
                            java.io.File profileFolder)
        Set the path of the different files for a PMStep to be executed. The method is used by PMScenario in a static way because it has no reasons to change within a PM simulation, except for the parcel file that must be updated after each PMStep to make the new PMStep simulation on an already simulated parcel plan

      • execute

        public java.io.File execute()
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Execute the current PM Step.
        Returns:
        The ShapeFile containing the whole parcels of the given collection, where the simulated parcel have replaced the former parcels.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getSimulationParcels

        public org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection getSimulationParcels(org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection parcelIn)
                                                                      throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                             org.opengis.referencing.NoSuchAuthorityCodeException,
                                                                             org.opengis.referencing.FactoryException
        Mark the parcels that must be simulated within a collection of parcels. It first select the parcel of the zone studied, whether by a city code or by a zone type. The fields can be set with the setters of the ParcelGetter class. Then it marks the interesting parcels that either cross a given polygon collection or intersects a zoning type. It return even the parcels that won't be simulated. Split field name in "SPLIT" by default and can be changed with the method MarkParcelAttributeFromPosition.setMarkFieldName(String). If none of this informations are set, the algorithm selects all the parcels. TODO find a way to either select parcels nearby the communities to avoid the simulation to think city's parcels are surrounded with mega giant freeways
        Returns:
        The parcel collection with a mark for the interesting parcels to simulate.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        org.opengis.referencing.FactoryException
        org.opengis.referencing.NoSuchAuthorityCodeException
        java.lang.Exception

      • getBoundsOfZone

        public org.locationtech.jts.geom.Geometry getBoundsOfZone()
                                                   throws java.io.IOException,
                                                          java.lang.Exception
        Generate the bound of the parcels that are simulated by the current PMStep. Uses the marked parcels by the getSimulationParcels(SimpleFeatureCollection) method.
        Returns:
        A geometry of the simulated parcels
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.Exception
